p: The cellular tropism of a virus is determined by the susceptibility of host cells to be infected. This is determined, in part, by the presence of the receptor needed for entry: the ACE2 receptor in the case of SARS-CoV-2. ACE2 is expressed in several human tissues, including lungs, small intestine, kidneys, heart, thyroid, adipose tissue, the infection of which by the SARS-CoV-2 can result in diverse symptoms ( 15, 16). Common COVID-19 symptoms are fever, cough, and fatigue. Other symptoms that have also been observed include headache, diarrhea, and anosmia ( 17, 18), demonstrating that SARS-CoV-2 can infect cells in other human organs ( 19). In some cases, however, the infection can be asymptomatic or paucisymptomatic (causing little or no clinical manifestations) ( 20).
